name: Animal Shelter Alliance
description: As a club, we raise awareness for the humane society and advocate care for homeless animals. We help out multiple shelters through teamwork and volunteering, including making toys and treats for homeless pets.

name: ASL Club and Honor Society
description: For those interested in taking ASL who couldn't get into the class to learn about ASL and Deaf culture / community. Those that are ASL Honor Society members will participate in club and Honor Society hour fulfillment will be discussed

name: Black Student Union
description: The Black Student Union is committed to highlighting and uplifting the varied realities of the African American experiences within our community.
sectionOneContent: The MHS Black Student Union maintains that a multicultural and just community is the penultimate goal, however, we also recognize that the African American experience is a unique one, specifically in a predominantly white community. Therefore, we recognize the need to create a safe and affirming space, specifically geared to African American/Black students that speaks to their heritage, culture and history. By intentionally curating this community, we hope to form bonds between Black students that are, at times, hard to create given how we have been dispersed in the diaspora.  Consequently, the Black Student Union is critical to maintain, sustain, buttress and bolster African American students. We affirm our commitment to highlighting and uplifting the varied realities of the African American experiences within our community.  We recognize and affirm that everyone has a unique perspective and lens through which they engage the world.  We welcome all allies who are genuinely willing to support the organization by utilizing their time and talent for the uplifting of future leaders at MHS and beyond.

name: Blankets for Benefit
description: Blankets for Benefit is a club for anyone who wants to make a difference while having fun! We make fabric tie blankets and donate them to local hospitals, homeless shelters, and foster agencies. Help the community and have fun making blankets! No experience necessary and no mandatory meetings.

name: Cards for a Cause
description: We are a community service club that hand-makes cards or other small gifts for local hospitals, senior living centers, nonprofit organizations, etc. Members may make cards at home and drop them off in B310 or sign up for Mrs. Cronin's connect session! This will also count for volunteer hours. Anyone can join at any time, and there are no mandatory meetings. You can contact us at mhscfac@masonohioschools.com

name: Comet Crochet and Knitting
description: Comet Crochet and Knitting provides a place for students to meet others with a shared interest in crochet or knitting. Members can work on individual crochet/knitting projects, or work on club projects. We give back to the Mason community through donations of crocheted or knitted items to local nonprofits, shelters, and charities. Students with no experience knitting or crocheting but are interested in learning are welcome to join!

name: Comet Skippers
description: We are a competitive jump rope team. We build youth leadership skills and team cooperation skills. Our club is a year-round activity, from September to May for younger teammates, through July for older more competitive teammates. We host tryouts in May. We offer After School Enrichment Programs at MECC, ME and MI. Many students start there. If they really enjoy jumping rope, they try out for the team.

name: Comets in Action
description: The mission of the Comets in Action (C.I.A.) club is to create an environment in which all students, those with and without disabilities, have opportunities to build rewarding friendships with peers at Mason High School.

name: Computer Science Honor Society
description: The National Computer Science Honor Society is a club that  encourages enthusiasm for computer science and promotes and recognizes academic excellence and service among high school computer science students.

name: Environmental Club
description: Our mission is to educate the student body, spread awareness, and take direct action on environmental issues/injustices in hopes of becoming a more eco-friendly and environmentally-conscious Mason.We aim to accomplish this through educational campaigns, social media posts and infographics, hosting events/projects, pledges, and running fundraisers.

name: Film Club
description: Film Club meets regularly to watch movies and discuss them.

name: Global Language Initiative
description: GLI is all about learning and teaching languages while also sharing aspects of cultures with other students in Mason. This is the perfect club for you if you want to learn a new language, practice one that you know, teach someone else the languages you know, or learn about other countries and cultures. This club is a great way to make friends while learning a brand new skill. The club offers multiple languages ranging from Spanish to Turkish to Mandarin Chinese to Korean to Arabic to Tamil and Hindi. We aim to share the love of language learning with everyone at Mason! Global awareness and compassion starts here!

name: GSA
description: Mason High School Gender Sexuality Alliance.  Discuss LGBTQ+ topics in a safe and inviting space. Meetings on select Wednesday after school in C108. See Schoology for more details.

name: HOSA
description: HOSA is a global student-led organization recognized by the U.S. Department of Education and the Department of Health and Human Services and several federal and state agencies. HOSAâ€™s mission is to empower HOSA-Future Health Professionals to become leaders in the global health community, through education, collaboration, and experience. HOSA actively promotes career opportunities in the health industry and to enhance the delivery of quality health care to all people. HOSA provides a unique program of leadership development, motivation, and recognition exclusively for students enrolled in health science education and biomedical science programs or have interests in pursuing careers in health professions. HOSA is 100% health care!

name: Ice Hockey
description: We are an OHSAA sanctioned athletic team that competes with other high schools in the state. We offer options for both JV and Varsity teams and have a mix of experienced and beginner players. Whether you have been playing your whole life, or just want to get started, we would love to have you.

name: International Club
description: International Club is a globally-oriented organization. We focus on cultures around the world, while also conducting leadership and service projects to help the community like the Taste of Mason.

name: Investment Club
description: Investment club provides financial and investment education to young people planning to start their journey in investing. Investment club covers topics such as fundamental analysis, technical analysis, and other strategies to help people become better investors. Investment club also has a branch dedicated to public speaking through their stock pitch competitions in which students have to choose a stock and present why it is a good buy to a panel of judges.

name: Live Music Club
description: The live music club, AKA the AMs, is a band that plays live shows before school in the front lobby once a month or so, as well as other gigs such as the Talent Show. This club meets from 2:45-4:30 PM on Fridays throughout the school year. All instruments are welcome, but all members should be somewhat skilled on their instrument and have a basic knowledge of music theory. Membership is limited for this club, so auditions for new members are held at the beginning of the school year.

name: Mason A Cappella
description:
The MHS Contemporary A Cappella Program is made up of two auditioned ensembles (NOTEORIOUS & SIREN), which meet after school and/or during evening hours.  Students selected for this ensemble will have demonstrated proper vocal technique, sight singing, and ear training skills and appropriate rehearsal/performance discipline.  Repertoire studied will be of varying difficulty levels in the pop/jazz style.  Students selected must be available for mandatory rehearsals beginning in early August and must also be available for after school and evening rehearsals, public performances, and competitions throughout the year. Students can earn 0.5 performing arts credit for this ensemble.
Grade Level:    9-12
Prerequisites:  Audition, Must be enrolled in a curricular MHS choir, band, or orchestra and have Choral Director recommendation.
